definition: to be transferred to another post/to post away
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
office/duty

sentences.english: Did he tell you why I asked for the transfer?
sentences.chinese: 他告诉你我为什么要求调职了吗？

sentences.english: He was demoted and was transferred from Taipei branch to Kaohsiung branch.
sentences.chinese: 他被降职并从台北分公司调职到高雄分公司。

sentences.english: I will quit in the event that I get transferred.
sentences.chinese: 如果我被调职的话，我就会辞职。

sentences.english: The transfer posting is where all income from selling players is saved.
sentences.chinese: 转让调职是出售球员的收入全部节省。

sentences.english: It's said that those government officials who had blown the whistle also got transferred.
sentences.chinese: 据说检举这件事的官员也被调职了。

sentences.english: I will speak to him personally about his transfer.
sentences.chinese: 我将私下跟他谈调职之事。

sentences.english: P-T In 1998, I moved across to marketing.
sentences.chinese: 1998年，我调职到了市场营销部门。

definition: to demote (to a lower rank)
to resume a post
to transfer/to move to another post
promote/promotion
to get promoted (at work etc)/promotion
to be promoted to
to ask sb to resign from a post
to hold an office or post
to dismiss/to discharge/to fire
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to set apart/to assign sb to a job
to temporarily transfer (personnel)
one's immediate superior
to promote (sb)/to upgrade/to ascend
restored to one's official post/to send sb back to his former post
